newsitem.title: USA: Assets of U.S. money market funds rose in week.
newsitem.headline: Assets of U.S. money market funds rose in week.

text.p: Assets of the nation's 659 retail money market mutual funds rose $3.85 billion to $597.93 billion in the week ended Oct. 23, the Investment Company Institute, an industry trade group, said Thursday.
It said assets of the 403 taxable money market funds in the retail category rose $3.51 billion to $488.38 billion, while assets of the 256 tax-exempt funds rose $337.2 million to $109.56 billion.

The trade group said assets of the 312 institutional money market funds fell $3.43 billion to $279.46 billion. Of these, the 248 taxable money market fund assets fell $3.03 billion to $250.65 billion, and assets of the 64 tax exempt funds fell $394.9 million to $28.80 billion.
Money market mutual fund assets stood at $877.39 billion in the week. Assets for the week ended Oct. 16 were revised to $876.97 billion from $875.02 billion.
